title: In-game, when I smartcast my ward, my left click won't place it down.
body:
Hi, first time here.
Just wondering if there is a fix to the way I place my wards. When it's area of where to place it appears, the cursor is blue and my left click cannot place it down. Just going to let you know, I've tried deleting my input in the config of LOL, but once I restart the client, it remains the same way as before. Apparently, there is supposed to be a .ini on the input file but mine doesn't seem to have it. Please help, I cannot stand the amount of wards I've misplaced during the month.

Figaro

replies.body:
Hey there,

>I've tried deleting my input in the config of LOL, but once I restart the client, it remains the same way as before.

Your settings are saved to the server nowadays, to reset them you need to do the following.

1. Log into your game client.
2. Delete the games config folder, including persistedsettings.json and input.ini
3. Launch a custom game, confirm settings are set to defaults.
4. Exit the game, your settings will then sync to the server.

>Apparently, there is supposed to be a .ini on the input file but mine doesn't seem to have it.

Windows hides file extensions by default, this is nothing to be concerned about the file is still the same.
There's a handy guide [here](http://www.howtohaven.com/system/show-file-extensions-in-windows-explorer.shtml) on how to enable hidden file extensions.

Just tried your tactic, I deleted my config then opened up my client. I created a custom game but when I tried to quickcast my q (as fiora), my left click couldn't activate it. it shows the indicator and the cursor but my left click doesn't make it work. Btw, my mouse (Logitech Hyperion Fury)  is a year old but still functional. Is there any other way?
Read the steps again, you need to have your client open and logged in BEFORE you delete the config folder.

WOW, THANK YOU SO MUCH. I can now quickcast and smartcast properly! My keybindings were messed up so I am extremely appreciative for your help! 

Cheers, SephirothSG :D

No problem, glad we were able to get your issue resolved.

See you on the Rift.

If you have smartcast on then the mouse button is removed from the equation. When you smartcast a ward just pressing the button will place it wherever your cursor is hovering. I'm not sure if having indicators on affects this. If you want to actually click your mouse to place the ward, you'll have to take smartcast off your wards.

Hello there,
Quickcasting is something I'm extremely used to ever since S3. Smartcasting is just extremely uncomfortable, Idk why :/

Thanks for the comment though!
Sorry then I misunderstood :) Hope you can get it fixed.
